contentrichtext.text: {{wiktionary|mosaic}} '''[[Mosaic]]''' is decorative art involving small pieces of glass, stone, or other material. '''Mosaic''' may also refer to: {{TOC right}} == Art == * [[Mosaic (Fabergé egg)]], a jewelled enameled Easter egg made under the supervision of the Russian jeweller Peter Carl Fabergé in 1914 * [[Photographic mosaic]] == Literature and media == * ''[[Mosaic: Pieces of My Life So Far]]'', a 2007 autobiography by Amy Grant * [[Mosaic (film)|''Mosaic'' (film)]], a 2007 animated film about a character created by Stan Lee * ''[[Mosaic, a journal for the interdisciplinary study of literature]]'', published in Canada * ''[[Mosaic: World News from the Middle East]]'', a program on U.S. free satellite channel LinkTV * ''[[Green Lantern: Mosaic]]'', a 1992 DC Comics series * [[Mosaic (Love of Diagrams album)|''Mosaic'' (Love of Diagrams album)]], a 2007 album by Love Of Diagrams * ''[[Mosaic: A Celebration of Blue Note Records]]'', a 2009 album by The Blue Note 7 * [[Mosaic (Wang Chung album)|''Mosaic'' (Wang Chung album)]], a 1986 album by British New Wave band, Wang Chung * [[Mosaic (Art Blakey album)|''Mosaic'' (Art Blakey album)]], 1961 * [[Mosaic (Purple Haze album)|''Mosaic'' (Purple Haze album)]], 2008 * [[Mosaic (Woven Hand album)|''Mosaic'' (Woven Hand album)]], the third album proper by David Eugene Edwards' Woven Hand * ''[[Mosaik]]'', a German comic magazine * [[Mosaic (vocal band)]], vocal band from the United States * ''[[Mozaiq]]'', a 2007 album by Blood Stain Child == Science == * [[Mosaic (genetics)]] or mosaicism, the presence of two populations of cells with different genotypes in one individual * A [[X-ray crystallography#Methods|mosaic crystal]] is one in which the unit cells are not identical * [[Mosaic virus]], a virus which attacks ornamental and crop plants * A mosaic of [[habitat (ecology)]] , made of multiple habitat types * [[Mosaic theory (investments)]], a finance concept * ''[[Colobura dirce]]'', a species of butterfly known as Mosaic == Software and video == * [[Mosaic (geodemography)]], classification software * [[Mosaic (web browser)]], the first popular web browser, produced by the NCSA * [[VMS Mosaic]], a GUI web browser for use on the OpenVMS operating system * [[Netscape Navigator]], briefly known as ''Mosaic Netscape'' * [[Mosaic notation program]], a music composition and notation program * A software package used to analyse radio telescope data, particularly that coming from the [[Australia Telescope National Facility]] * The effect of [[pixelization]], a video- and image-editing technique * ''Mosaic'', an iPhone strategy game by [[Kudit]] ==Religion and culture== * Matters relative to [[Moses]], the Biblical Hebrew leader and prophet ** "Mosaic religion", an obsolete synonym for [[Judaism]] ** [[Mosaic law]] relating to the laws of Moses * [[Mosaic (church)]], pastored by Erwin McManus, in Los Angeles, California, U.S. * [[Cultural mosaic]], the co-existence of ethnic groups, languages and cultures within Canada * An alternative term, used by the Barna Research Group, for what is popularly called the Millennial Generation—see [[George Barna]] ==Companies== * [[Mosaic Records]], a jazz record label * [[The Mosaic Company]], a Fortune 500 chemical company * [[Mosaic Inc.]], a solar finance company ==See also== * [[MOSAIC (disambiguation)]] {{disambig}}
